Dīpi Jātaka：Goatherds once occupied an ascetic’s hut，and，on their departure，left behind a she-goat who had strayed away．As she ran to join the others，she saw a panther in the way； she showed great daring and tried to pacify him with soft words，but all in vain，for he devoured her.

The story was related in reference to a she-goat whom Moggallāna once saw near his mountain hut．When she，however，saw a panther，she，with great daring，jumped over his body and escaped．J.iii.479f.
